metadata.name: Japan Briefing
metadata.description: Daily news briefing for the NYT Tokyo Bureau Chief

all.headline: スノーボード女子ビッグエア 村瀬心椛が金メダル 五輪
all.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック、スノーボード女子ビッグエアで村瀬心椛選手が金メダルを獲得しました。オリンピックのスノーボードで日本の女子選手が金メダルを獲得したのは初めてです。

all.headline: スキージャンプ男子ノーマルヒル 二階堂蓮が銅メダル 五輪
all.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック、スキージャンプ男子ノーマルヒルで、初出場の二階堂蓮選手が銅メダルを獲得しました。この種目で、2大会連続の金メダルを目指した小林陵侑選手は8位でした。

all.headline: スピードスケート女子1000m 高木美帆が銅メダル 五輪
all.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック、スピードスケートの女子1000メートルで高木美帆選手が銅メダルを獲得しました。高木選手はこの種目で3大会連続のメダル獲得です。

all.headline: 日本 NATOのウクライナ支援の枠組みに参加の方針固める
all.description: NATO＝北大西洋条約機構がウクライナを支援するために設置したアメリカ製の兵器などを購入して供与する枠組みに、日本が参加する方針を固めたことが複数のNATO当局者への取材でわかりました。日本から提供される資金で購入するのは、殺傷能力のない防衛装備品に限定されるとしています。

all.headline: ガザ地区 停戦合意発効から4か月 「平和評議会」19日にも開催
all.description: パレスチナのガザ地区をめぐる停戦合意が発効してから10日で4か月となります。アメリカは、19日にもガザ地区の暫定的な統治を監督する組織の会合を開き、復興について話し合う見通しで、多額の復興資金をどのように調達するのかが焦点となります。

all.headline: 高市首相 食料品の消費税減税など 公約の政策の検討加速
all.description: 衆議院選挙での自民党の圧勝を受けて、高市総理大臣は2年間に限った食料品の消費税減税など、政権公約に掲げた政策の検討を加速させる方針です。一方、参議院では与党が過半数に届いていないことを踏まえ、新年度予算案の審議などでは、引き続き野党側と丁寧に合意形成を図っていくことにしています。

all.headline: 中道 近く代表選を実施へ 泉健太氏や小川淳也氏を推す声も
all.description: 中道改革連合の野田・斉藤両共同代表は衆議院選挙で大敗した責任をとって、辞任することになりました。近く代表選挙を行う方向で調整が進められていて、立憲民主党の幹部だった泉健太氏や小川淳也氏を推す声も出ています。

all.headline: Arab states criticize Israel as it expands powers in occupied West Bank
all.description: They said the moves were meant to entrench Israeli settlement of the West Bank, displace Palestinians and impose unlawful Israeli sovereignty.

all.headline: Japan's Kokomo Murase clinches Olympic snowboarding big air gold
all.description: Murase executed her final jump perfectly to surge into the lead and take her first Olympic gold medal.

all.headline: Dutch pair in a class of their own as Japan's Takagi wins eighth Olympic medal
all.description: Femke Kok set an Olympic record but her teammate one-upped her in the final pairing of the night as the Netherlands took the top two podium places in the women's 1,000 meters.

all.headline: Smile Japan loses Olympic heartbreaker to Italy
all.description: The favored Japanese squad got behind early for the second-straight game and couldn’t recover as Italy took a 3-2 decision.

all.headline: Uncertainty clouds JIP's role in ruling coalition following LDP's election win
all.description: With the Liberal Democratic Party winning so many seats, the prime minister may begin to disregard its junior coalition partner's views, one political scientist says.

all.headline: Is Takaichi on course for a long-term reign?
all.description: The resounding win for the Liberal Democratic Party in Sunday’s Lower House election might be the start of an enduring administration for Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi.

all.headline: It’s Sanae Takaichi’s Japan, as PM’s persona powers LDP to electoral success
all.description: Sunday’s electoral triumph by the Liberal Democratic Party is less a master stroke of the party than a success of its indisputable architect: Takaichi herself.

all.headline: The long road to recovery after the CRA’s election loss
all.description: The new party must find new leadership after a crushing debut defeat.

all.headline: Nikkei 225 rises 3.89% and hits record after Takaichi's big win on Sunday
all.description: The benchmark index hit an all-time high of 57,337.07 in the morning and is now up more than 45% over the past year.

all.headline: With 68 seats, record-high female representation in Lower House slips slightly
all.description: The women account for 14.6% of all elected Lower House lawmakers, after female candidates secured a record 73 seats the 2024 general election.

all.headline: Milano Cortina 2026: Ren Nikaido Wins “Tied” Bronze in Men’s Ski Jumping Normal Hill; Moves Up from 6th after First Jump
all.description: Ren Nikaido won the bronze medal in the men's normal hill ski jumping event (HS107m, K-point 98m) at the Milan-Cortina Olympics on Monday.

all.headline: Milano Cortina 2026: Kokomo Murase Wins Gold in Women’s Snowboard Big Air; First for Japanese Women
all.description: Kokomo Murase won the gold medal in the women's snowboard big air final at the Milano Cortina Olympics on Monday.

all.headline: Japan Opposition Party Reiwa Shinsengumi Suffers Steep Loss; Drops to Just 1 Seat in House of Representatives
all.description: Reiwa Shinsengumi was down to just one seat in the House of Representatives after Sunday’s election, falling from the eight it held before the official campaign period.

all.headline: DPFP Has Mediocre Results in Japan’s Polls on Sunday, But Party Still Gains More Seats Than Before
all.description: The Democratic Party for the People had a mediocre showing in the House of Representatives election on Sunday, although DPFP executives won single-seat constituencies and the party won more seats than

all.headline: Japan’s Sumitomo Life Employees Mishandled Nearly 800 Documents at Agencies
all.description: Employees of Sumitomo Life Insurance Co. were found to have taken or photographed, without permission, 780 documents from the eight agencies to which they had been assigned, the company announced on M

all.headline: Takaichi Set to Boost High-Level Diplomacy, Firm Foundation at Home Expected to Give Stronger Position Abroad
all.description: Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi is set to ramp up high-level diplomacy following the House of Representatives election.

all.headline: Takaichi Vows to Push through Key Policy Measures (Update 1)
Measles Victim Flew Between Tokyo, Hokkaido in Late January; Likely Came into Contact with Many
all.description: A man confirmed to have contracted measles may have come into contact with a large number of people while traveling between Tokyo and Hokkaido.

all.headline: Batting Cage in Tokyo Still Takes ¥100 Coins for Batting Practice Sessions Loved by Locals Since 1978
all.description: A boy holding a baseball bat was quietly watching a pitching machine about a dozen meters away. After having swung and missed several times, he was eventually able to make contact and hit the balls fo

all.headline: Chinese National Driving Lamborghini Arrested After Traffic Collision Injures 2 Police Officers in Kachidoki, Tokyo
all.description: A Chinese man, 41, who crashed into a police car injuring 2 police officers on Sunday in Kachidoki, Tokyo, was arrested Monday on suspicion of violating the Law on Dangerous Driving Causing Death or I

Hong Kong pro-democracy tycoon Jimmy Lai gets 20 years' jail
all.description: Lai's supporters say this amounts to a death sentence, but authorities say it demonstrates the rule of law.

all.headline: Japanese stocks surge as Takaichi secures historic election victory
all.description: Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi's Liberal Democratic Party  secured 316 out of 465 seats in Sunday's election.

all.headline: Who is Jimmy Lai, Hong Kong's pro-democracy tycoon?
all.description: The 78-year-old, who has been jailed for 20 years, was a prominent advocate for democracy in the former British territory.

all.headline: Are Bangladesh's youth turning against India?
all.description: Anti-Indianism is rising in Bangladesh as ties between the South Asian neighbours sink to a new low.

all.headline: Thai PM claims election victory with conservatives well ahead of rivals
all.description: The ruling conservatives defied opinion polls predicting a win for the reformist People's Party.

all.headline: Christchurch shooter seeks to overturn guilty plea
all.description: Brenton Tarrant is serving a life sentence after murdering 51 people in the March 2019 attack on two mosques in New Zealand.

all.headline: Australia's opposition coalition reunites after row over hate-speech laws
all.description: The Nationals had split from the Liberals citing free speech concerns over laws brought in after the Bondi Beach attack.

all.headline: Alleged mastermind among four arrested after Pakistan mosque blast
all.description: The four are suspected of facilitating a suicide bombing that killed more than 30 people, Pakistan's interior minister said.

all.headline: S Korean crypto firm accidentally pays out $40bn in bitcoin
all.description: The company quickly realised its mistake and managed to recover virtually all the missing tokens from customers.

all.headline: At least 18 die in 'rat-hole' mine blast in India
all.description: Rescue operations are on as more people are feared trapped inside the mine, police say.

all.headline: How Indonesia's new sex laws will affect tourists
all.description: International travelers have been flocking back to the popular resort island of Bali as the Covid pandemic subsides, prompting hopes that Indonesia's battered tourism industry is on the road to recove

all.headline: Afghanistan
North Korea
This 'edible' plastic bag alternative could save Nara's sacred deer
all.description: A local entrepreneur in the Japanese tourist destination of Nara has developed an alternative to plastic shopping bags, to protect the town's sacred deer.

all.headline: The battle to save Sri Lanka's leopards
all.description: Having endured a bloody civil war from 1983 until 2009, Sri Lanka is now at peace and developing rapidly. That's good news for the country as a whole, but the island nation's leopards are under threat

all.headline: Wildlife is flourishing around Fukushima
all.description: Nearly a decade after Japan's Fukushima nuclear disaster, researchers have discovered that wildlife is thriving in the areas evacuated by humans, despite radiological contamination.

all.headline: China debuts 620 kph train prototype
all.description: China has revealed a prototype for a new high-speed Maglev train that is capable of reaching speeds of 620 kilometers (385 miles) per hour.

all.headline: A Shanghai building 'walks' to a new location
all.description: Shanghai residents passing through the city's eastern Huangpu district in October might have stumbled upon an unusual sight: a "walking" building.

all.headline: Self-driving robotaxis are taking off in China
all.description: The world has been inching toward fully autonomous cars for years. In China, one company just got even closer to making it a reality.

all.headline: Travel to Japan during Covid-19: What you need to know
all.description: If you're planning a trip to Japan, here's what you'll need to know and expect if you want to visit during the global coronavirus pandemic.

competitors.description: Nearly a decade after Japan's Fukushima nuclear disaster, researchers have discovered that wildlife is thriving in the areas evacuated by humans, despite radiological contamination.

primary.headline: スノーボード女子ビッグエア 村瀬心椛が金メダル 五輪
primary.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック、スノーボード女子ビッグエアで村瀬心椛選手が金メダルを獲得しました。オリンピックのスノーボードで日本の女子選手が金メダルを獲得したのは初めてです。

primary.headline: スキージャンプ男子ノーマルヒル 二階堂蓮が銅メダル 五輪
primary.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック、スキージャンプ男子ノーマルヒルで、初出場の二階堂蓮選手が銅メダルを獲得しました。この種目で、2大会連続の金メダルを目指した小林陵侑選手は8位でした。

primary.headline: スピードスケート女子1000m 高木美帆が銅メダル 五輪
primary.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック、スピードスケートの女子1000メートルで高木美帆選手が銅メダルを獲得しました。高木選手はこの種目で3大会連続のメダル獲得です。

primary.headline: 日本 NATOのウクライナ支援の枠組みに参加の方針固める
primary.description: NATO＝北大西洋条約機構がウクライナを支援するために設置したアメリカ製の兵器などを購入して供与する枠組みに、日本が参加する方針を固めたことが複数のNATO当局者への取材でわかりました。日本から提供される資金で購入するのは、殺傷能力のない防衛装備品に限定されるとしています。

primary.headline: ガザ地区 停戦合意発効から4か月 「平和評議会」19日にも開催
primary.description: パレスチナのガザ地区をめぐる停戦合意が発効してから10日で4か月となります。アメリカは、19日にもガザ地区の暫定的な統治を監督する組織の会合を開き、復興について話し合う見通しで、多額の復興資金をどのように調達するのかが焦点となります。

primary.headline: 高市首相 食料品の消費税減税など 公約の政策の検討加速
primary.description: 衆議院選挙での自民党の圧勝を受けて、高市総理大臣は2年間に限った食料品の消費税減税など、政権公約に掲げた政策の検討を加速させる方針です。一方、参議院では与党が過半数に届いていないことを踏まえ、新年度予算案の審議などでは、引き続き野党側と丁寧に合意形成を図っていくことにしています。

primary.headline: 中道 近く代表選を実施へ 泉健太氏や小川淳也氏を推す声も
primary.description: 中道改革連合の野田・斉藤両共同代表は衆議院選挙で大敗した責任をとって、辞任することになりました。近く代表選挙を行う方向で調整が進められていて、立憲民主党の幹部だった泉健太氏や小川淳也氏を推す声も出ています。

primary.headline: Arab states criticize Israel as it expands powers in occupied West Bank
primary.description: They said the moves were meant to entrench Israeli settlement of the West Bank, displace Palestinians and impose unlawful Israeli sovereignty.

primary.headline: Japan's Kokomo Murase clinches Olympic snowboarding big air gold
primary.description: Murase executed her final jump perfectly to surge into the lead and take her first Olympic gold medal.

primary.headline: Dutch pair in a class of their own as Japan's Takagi wins eighth Olympic medal
primary.description: Femke Kok set an Olympic record but her teammate one-upped her in the final pairing of the night as the Netherlands took the top two podium places in the women's 1,000 meters.

primary.headline: Smile Japan loses Olympic heartbreaker to Italy
primary.description: The favored Japanese squad got behind early for the second-straight game and couldn’t recover as Italy took a 3-2 decision.

primary.headline: Uncertainty clouds JIP's role in ruling coalition following LDP's election win
primary.description: With the Liberal Democratic Party winning so many seats, the prime minister may begin to disregard its junior coalition partner's views, one political scientist says.

primary.headline: Is Takaichi on course for a long-term reign?
primary.description: The resounding win for the Liberal Democratic Party in Sunday’s Lower House election might be the start of an enduring administration for Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi.

primary.headline: It’s Sanae Takaichi’s Japan, as PM’s persona powers LDP to electoral success
primary.description: Sunday’s electoral triumph by the Liberal Democratic Party is less a master stroke of the party than a success of its indisputable architect: Takaichi herself.

primary.headline: The long road to recovery after the CRA’s election loss
primary.description: The new party must find new leadership after a crushing debut defeat.

primary.headline: Nikkei 225 rises 3.89% and hits record after Takaichi's big win on Sunday
primary.description: The benchmark index hit an all-time high of 57,337.07 in the morning and is now up more than 45% over the past year.

primary.headline: With 68 seats, record-high female representation in Lower House slips slightly
primary.description: The women account for 14.6% of all elected Lower House lawmakers, after female candidates secured a record 73 seats the 2024 general election.

primary.headline: Milano Cortina 2026: Ren Nikaido Wins “Tied” Bronze in Men’s Ski Jumping Normal Hill; Moves Up from 6th after First Jump
primary.description: Ren Nikaido won the bronze medal in the men's normal hill ski jumping event (HS107m, K-point 98m) at the Milan-Cortina Olympics on Monday.

primary.headline: Milano Cortina 2026: Kokomo Murase Wins Gold in Women’s Snowboard Big Air; First for Japanese Women
primary.description: Kokomo Murase won the gold medal in the women's snowboard big air final at the Milano Cortina Olympics on Monday.

primary.headline: Japan Opposition Party Reiwa Shinsengumi Suffers Steep Loss; Drops to Just 1 Seat in House of Representatives
primary.description: Reiwa Shinsengumi was down to just one seat in the House of Representatives after Sunday’s election, falling from the eight it held before the official campaign period.

primary.headline: DPFP Has Mediocre Results in Japan’s Polls on Sunday, But Party Still Gains More Seats Than Before
primary.description: The Democratic Party for the People had a mediocre showing in the House of Representatives election on Sunday, although DPFP executives won single-seat constituencies and the party won more seats than

primary.headline: Japan’s Sumitomo Life Employees Mishandled Nearly 800 Documents at Agencies
primary.description: Employees of Sumitomo Life Insurance Co. were found to have taken or photographed, without permission, 780 documents from the eight agencies to which they had been assigned, the company announced on M

primary.headline: Takaichi Set to Boost High-Level Diplomacy, Firm Foundation at Home Expected to Give Stronger Position Abroad
primary.description: Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi is set to ramp up high-level diplomacy following the House of Representatives election.

primary.headline: Takaichi Vows to Push through Key Policy Measures (Update 1)
Measles Victim Flew Between Tokyo, Hokkaido in Late January; Likely Came into Contact with Many
primary.description: A man confirmed to have contracted measles may have come into contact with a large number of people while traveling between Tokyo and Hokkaido.

primary.headline: Batting Cage in Tokyo Still Takes ¥100 Coins for Batting Practice Sessions Loved by Locals Since 1978
primary.description: A boy holding a baseball bat was quietly watching a pitching machine about a dozen meters away. After having swung and missed several times, he was eventually able to make contact and hit the balls fo

primary.headline: Chinese National Driving Lamborghini Arrested After Traffic Collision Injures 2 Police Officers in Kachidoki, Tokyo
primary.description: A Chinese man, 41, who crashed into a police car injuring 2 police officers on Sunday in Kachidoki, Tokyo, was arrested Monday on suspicion of violating the Law on Dangerous Driving Causing Death or I

secondary.headline: Are Bangladesh's youth turning against India?
secondary.description: Anti-Indianism is rising in Bangladesh as ties between the South Asian neighbours sink to a new low.
